From: Daniel Dickinson <cshore@wightman.ca>
To: Debian Bug Tracking System <submit@bugs.debian.org>
Subject: rhythmbox: Goes to 100% and stops producing sound for many flac files
Message-ID: <20080413150148.5772.71031.reportbug@brennin.fionavar.com>
X-Mailer: reportbug 3.39
Date: Sun, 13 Apr 2008 11:01:48 -0400
Delivered-To: submit@bugs.debian.org

Package: rhythmbox
Version: 0.11.5-1
Severity: important


Since upgrading rhythmbox I have run into an issue with playing my audio files (which are all flac).  For many songs, the CPU goes to 100% and sound output stops.  Top reports 97-100% of CPU is in rhythmbox.

-- System Information:
Debian Release: lenny/sid
  APT prefers testing
  APT policy: (500, 'testing'), (500, 'stable')
Architecture: i386 (i686)

Kernel: Linux 2.6.24-1-686 (SMP w/1 CPU core)
Locale: LANG=en_CA.UTF-8, LC_CTYPE=en_CA.UTF-8 (charmap=UTF-8)
Shell: /bin/sh linked to /bin/bash

The hardware was flaky.  Replacing the motherboard and cpu fixed the
problem (and others which led to the discovery of the real problem).
